laboratory_examinations.findings: HBsAg negative, HBsAb positive, HBcAb positive; indicates clearance of natural HBV infection.
AST level: 183 U/L, ALT level: 64 U/L; indicative of transaminitis.
HBsAg positive, HBeAg positive, HBsAb negative; indicative of active HBV infection.
AST level elevated, ALT level unchanged; presence of HBV DNA at 12000 pg/mL.
Changes consistent with chronic HBV infection; moderate disease activity and moderate-to-severe fibrosis.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No changes in serological test results; transaminase levels remained elevated.

laboratory_examinations.findings: HBV DNA suppressed to undetectable levels while receiving lamivudine.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: In July 2001, HBV DNA level elevated to 1370 pg/mL after stopping lamivudine therapy.
